spine_hook: Success = early-window buyer share reaches 20–30% while store footfall is up ≥10% without increasing loyalty discount depth.

anchors.headline: Early-window buyer share — current
anchors.expression: Transactions in first 48 hours = 12–15% of holiday-period transactions

anchors.headline: QR redemption — minimum
anchors.expression: QR-code redemptions ≥5% of counted in-store visits for event offers

measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Keeps acquisition cost efficient so events scale without deeper loyalty discounts.

measurement_plan.metric: Buyer activity share vs promo intensity
measurement_plan.expression: Early-window share 20–30% while promo SKU share ≈ LY
measurement_plan.notes: Track early-window transactions and percent of assortment on promo daily; pair-side-by-side.
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Shows whether buyer growth came from new buyers (good) or from heavier discounting (bad).

measurement_plan.notes: Use turnstile or POS door-count baseline; capture redemption id to tie to buyer origin.
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Validates event-driven discovery and measures clean take-up without loyalty price cuts.

measurement_plan.metric: Loyalty discount depth vs incremental sales
measurement_plan.expression: Do not increase average loyalty discount depth > 2 percentage points vs current; measure incremental sales from loyalty redemptions separately
measurement_plan.notes: Report discount depth, redemption share, and incremental revenue daily.
measurement_plan.why_it_matters: Protects margin and proves events, not deeper loyalty cuts, drove growth.
